text: to use an ec2 Mac instance start in the
AWS console specifically the ec2 pane
which can be reached after logging in by
searching ec2 at the bar at the top
we'll Begin by allowing a dedicated host
click dedicated hosts in the sidebar on
the left there's one host here already
let's add another click allocate
dedicated host and optionally give this
host a name tag from the instance family
drop down choose your desired instance
type in this case Mac 2 for the Apple
silicon Mac Mini further down click the
drop down for instance type and select
the only option available mac2.metal
choose your desired availability Zone
and I personally use Auto placement so I
don't need to specify which host gets an
instance in the next step when we start
it click allocate if there aren't any
hosts available in the AZ selected this
message tells me where there are some
just switch the AZ to that one click
allocate again and now the new host is
visible in the list
next we'll launch an instance onto it
click instances on the left then launch
instance give the instance a name and
select an Ami for Mac OS in this case
Mac OS Ventura change the architecture
drop down to the 64-bit Mac arm to match
our Mac 2 host and you'll see that
directly below the instance type
automatically changes to mac2.metal
choose an SSH key for remote access and
a security group with appropriate access
I'm using my default which is also set
up with only Port 22 open for SSH the
only other required setting is under the
advanced details disclosure triangle and
it's the drop down marked tenancy this
one needs to be set to Dedicated host
since Auto placement is on we don't need
to specify which host just that it
requires one with that finished click
launch instance to start your Mac
instance and it will be available to
connect to within minutes
if we're setting up an instance for Last
Mile there's two other important
settings before we hit that button The
Last Mile script in user data and an IAM
instance profile which needs sufficient
permissions to read the secrets Last
Mile may need see our GitHub repo for
more info on what that profile should
look like
with our instance launched and The Last
Mile script preloaded in user data and
instance can prompt a user to complete
enrollment automatically the user needs
only connect to the instance and follow
the instructions customized for the
specific version of the OS that's
detected once the profile installation
is complete Last Mile installs a launch
Daemon called Skyhook which will stop an
instance if it becomes unenrolled at any
point to prevent unmanaged activity
this instance is now able to receive
profiles policies apps and more from the
MDM server
